content.title: Vascular Rings and Pulmonary Artery Sling
content.definition: Congenital vascular anomalies in which abnormal vessels or their branches encircle and compress the trachea and/or esophagus, causing respiratory and feeding symptoms in infancy.

double_aortic_arch.anatomy: Both right and left arches persist, encircling trachea/esophagus

right_arch_left_ligament.anatomy: Right aortic arch with left-sided ductus/ligamentum

pulmonary_artery_sling.anatomy: Left pulmonary artery arises from right PA, courses between trachea and esophagus

clinical_presentation.age: Usually presents in first year of life

treatment.pulmonary_sling: Reimplantation of left PA +/- tracheal repair
